definitions: Offer or give up something valued for the sake of something else regarded as more important or worthy.
Kill an animal or person as part of a religious ritual.
Give up a pawn or other piece in chess for an advantage.
examples: She had to sacrifice her career for her family.
They sacrificed a lamb to their god.
He sacrificed the stock to avoid further losses.
The player sacrificed a knight to open up the king's side.
